text: Check the URL when you are editing the form. The first number in the slug (after /forms) is the portal ID and second alpha numeric the form ID (before /edit/form)
thanks

Ok, so the issue is 100% on your side. If I try to create the note by passing the `hs_attachment_ids` property during creation, that fails on free accounts. However, if I skip that property during creation, then set it during a second UPDATE call for the previously created note, all works as it should.
I'm not sure what's the best way to raise an issue report on this.

I should mention that we have paid for a different account and the same issue I mentioned before persisted so it might be that this is a difference between test accounts and actual accounts, making things even worse IMO.
Hi everyone - we must be missing something. Is it possible to get whether a user is a superadmin via the API?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>
Has anyone been successful syncing a public app with the crm
EX: User Oauths HubSpot on my platform X. Platform x and the users HubSpot both store contacts that should be synced
changes on HubSpot change on app, and vice versa
thanks in advance!
this helped me <@U02AW3LBSB1> - thanks so much for sharing!
Yeah - the issue is that permissions isn't in there, and when I look at the user provisioning end points, it's roles and teams. Can't find a place to grab whether they are a superadmin or not
I have a third party platform that is building our company an integration using API Calls. There is an issue with one of the actions created by the API Call...how do we get this issue resolved?
We have a screenshot of the error message.
Good morning! Whenever I change my company selection under contacts. (Field Type is Multiple Checkboxes) it doesn't trigger the webhooks. Even though I changed my scopes
And my subscriptions I can't find the property to subscribe to, and also I tried selecting "contact.associationChange"

Hi everybody! Does anyone knows how to get the timestamp a deal entered exited a stage?
I need to get every timestamp from a dealstage changes. Thanks!

For the V1 api there is a url parameter that gives you the history of the included properties.

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/get-all-deals>

I have not tried it out, but you could include the propertiesWithHistory=dealstage and go through all your deals. I was trying to find the equivalent for a specific deal but cant find it from my mobile. Maybe that already helps you.

You can also use propertiesWithHistory=dealstage on the v3 deals endpoint with both the `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?propertiesWithHistory=dealstage>` or `GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/{dealId}?propertiesWithHistory=dealstage>`
thanks! I'm gonna check it
You mentioned above field type is multiple checkboxes, are you looking to monitor the change of a specific contact property?
Just type the name of the property when creating the subscription and you can add it as an option.
If you are using a private key I would check the API access logs, the error message may be more helpful from HubSpot’s end.
Ohhh :open_mouth:  gotcha thank you so much!!
I don’t believe there is a public API available to get admin status of users
what do you mean "100% on your side"?

The fact that when creating notes with the aforementioned property the call fails silently on free accounts. If I instead first create the note then edit it to attach the file everything works as it should. This shouldn't be the case.
Ok I think you should report it
Is there anything to get access level - ie can they access settings, user list, etc?
I don’t think so. <@U01QVR44MEY> do you know if there is any way to achieve this?
Unfortunately no, the closest you can get right now is setting up roles and making on of those roles a super admin role
Gotcha - so this is probably why for example with Chatspot, a user can create a report and export to google sheets, even though they don't have access in native HubSpot to reports or export?
Yeah exactly
But you can for example create a super admin role and then check if the user has that role
Yeah gotcha, good for private apps, not good for 3rd party apps using Oauth
but if you're doing this through an app you would need some pretty beefy permissinos
yeah exactly
this is something I know the team is thinking about adding in the future
but if you added an idea on the ideas board that would definitely help bring it to fruition
yeah it makes it impossible to sync permissions across apps for internal admins, and is a huge risk for anyone building 3rd party apps
Yeah I definitely get it man, but don't really think HubSpot should be at the core of a permission management system
right?
nah but it should be able to receive permissions
For example, terminations
a workaround is for an app developer with oauth to hit an endpoint in settings (such as /account-info/v3/api-usage/daily) and if an error is returned, "probably not an admin"

Is 'objectType' the object name? (ie: LineItem)

Can you also just update options only or do you have to include label, type, fieldType, formField, etc... in the PATCH?
If the documentation does not have a * next to the parameter, it is not required for the request. <@U04Q5ARNZEV>
<@U038DUUV3GE> Thanks!
